title: Type specific to material
content:
I'm working on a project pertaining to type that was designed specifically for a particular use/material.  
Verdana was designed for the screen, Bell Gothic/Centennial was designed for use at small sizes and still be legible after dot gain, etc.

Are there others that have similar properties or features?
author: sage

comments.content:
Arial was created to piss off anybody with taste.

:-)

Just kidding. Comic Sans seems to have been created for a specific purpose:  
 [http://www.connare.com/comic.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101125852/http:/www.connare.com/comic.htm "http://www.connare.com/comic.htm")

Read through the font descriptions over at Hoefler and Frere-Jones or The Font Bureau web sites. Both foundries sell typefaces with pretty specific uses—just keep in mind that in some cases they will be fonts issued as part of a larger family.

And don’t forget about newspaper fonts. There’s a ton of great material out there about newspaper fonts.

[Frutiger](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101125852/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Frutiger) for signage  
 [Meta](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101125852/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Meta) for low quality printing  
 [Clearview](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101125852/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Clearview) for U.S. Highways

Hi there:

In addition to the above mentioned, Matthew Carter's Bitstream/ITC Charter was created for low resolution laser printers.

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bitstream\_Charter](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101125852/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bitstream_Charter "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bitstream\_Charter")  
 [http://www.graphic-design.com/Type/opentype/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101125852/http:/www.graphic-design.com/Type/opentype/index.html "http://www.graphic-design.com/Type/opentype/index.html")

For a similar purpose- Amerigo by Gerard Unger:  
 [http://www.gerardunger.com/allmytypedesigns/allmytypedesigns09.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101125852/http:/www.gerardunger.com/allmytypedesigns/allmytypedesigns09.html "http://www.gerardunger.com/allmytypedesigns/allmytypedesigns09.html")

Erik Spiekermann designed a special version of Meta suitable for metalic machine routing.  
 [http://www.spiekermann.com/mten/type\_schriften/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101125852/http:/www.spiekermann.com/mten/type_schriften/ "http://www.spiekermann.com/mten/type\_schriften/")

Also CP Company by Fabrizio Schiavi is specially designed and hinted for on screen use. There is also a special pixel font for Flash.

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=cp+company](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101125852/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=cp+company "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=cp+company")
